value.name: Nassau County Investing $5 Million In Police Body Cameras
value.description: In a major step toward police transparency on Long Island, Nassau County police officers will soon be equipped with body cameras. The county is about to invest $5 million in body cameras for its police force.

video.name: Nassau County Rolling Out Body Cameras For Police Officers

value.name: Atlanta Police need your help finding this missing man
value.description: The Atlanta Police Department is seeking the public’s aid in finding a missing elderly man with dementia. According to a news release, Fred Samuels, 84, has been diagnosed with dementia and was last seen May 25 at 4 a.

value.name: From poverty tows to Palestine: The violence of settler colonial evictions across Mama Earth
value.description: In crimes against humanity, politriksters and crapitalism execute evictions, sweeps, removals and disposals in the project of gentrification that are violent, traumatic and deadly on the increasing number of houseless people.

value.name: Two months after police killed him, Tyrell Wilson's story is already starting to fade
value.description: He watched the footage five times, replaying the brusque exchange that quickly turned violent on March 11, when a police officer shot 33-year-old Tyrell Wilson in the face. Tyrell’s death six days later thrust Danville into a now-familiar debate about policing and accountability.

value.name: Rosemary West could be questioned over missing Mary Bastholm as police prepare to dig up cafe cellar
value.description: Rosemary West could be questioned over the disappearance of missing schoolgirl Mary Bastholm, say police. Detectives are preparing to dig up the cellar of a Gloucester cafe after "possible evidence" she could be buried there.

value.name: 9 candidates named in police chief search
value.description: The next chief of police in Pine Bluff will come from outside the city, if a successful candidate is identified.

value.name: Police searching for missing 84-year-old Atlanta man with dementia
value.description: ATLANTA - Atlanta police need your help finding a missing 84-year-old who has been diagnosed with dementia. A Mattie's Call, Georgia's emergency missing alert for disabled or elderly persons, has been issued for 84-year-old Fred Samuels.

video.name: Police searching for missing 84-year-old Atlanta man with dementia

value.name: Parked in Mister Rogers' Neighborhood: What Fred Rogers Taught Us About Cars
value.description: Despite growing up in a wealthy family and being taken to school by the family driver in a Cadillac, Fred McFeely Rogers—known as Mister Rogers to most of us —never appeared to have developed a taste for exotic or expensive things.

value.name: 'Our America: A Year of Activism': How activism has evolved since the murder of George Floyd
value.description: A Year of Activism" comprises three panels that address intergenerational activism, multiracial solidarity and media framing of racial justice issues.

value.name: Despite calls for reform after George Floyd's death, no significant laws have been passed in NC
value.description: Thousands of North Carolinians took to the streets demanding criminal justice reform following George Floyd's death on May 25, 2020. A year later, those cries for change have not translated into significant laws passed at the state level.

video.name: Despite calls for reform after George Floyd's death, no significant laws have been passed in NC

value.name: More than 50 years before George Floyd's death, lawmakers predicted a growing racial divide
value.description: It's been a year since George Floyd's chilling last words, "I can't breathe," sent shock waves around the world. A guilty verdict came down April 20, but Black Americans had no time to celebrate the rare occurrence of a White police officer being convicted of the murder of a Black man.

value.name: Pennsylvania police agencies are whiter than communities they serve, even as leaders pursue diversity
value.description: Across Pennsylvania, leaders of mostly white police departments say they struggle to recruit minorities. Some believe they aren't trying hard enough.

video.name: Pennsylvania police agencies are whiter than communities they serve, even as leaders pursue diversity

value.name: Most Bucks and Montgomery County police officers are white men. How can that change?
value.description: Chiefs in Bucks and Montgomery counties say diversity is important. Advocates say they're not doing enough to reach it.

video.name: Most Bucks and Montgomery County police officers are white men. How can that change?

value.name: Making Fort Myers Police Department part of Lee County Sheriff's Office dies with no support
value.description: The idea of having Lee County sheriff's deputies take over crime prevention in Fort Myers drew no support from the public or city council Monday.
